pullRequest.body:
Adds the lemma, and `to_additive` tags it

nodes.body: I'm interested. What's your use case?

I have a project where I have lots of sums over `MvPolynomial` expressions. In the course of simplifying these expressions I sometimes come across this and want to simplify it.

I guess your next question will be "why not just use `simp`?. I think the main reason was probably for proof aesthetics - I conceptualize the simplification part of the proof as a sequence of steps where I first simplify various expressions involving sums over mapped lists, and then rearrange terms, and then I cast everything using `MvPolynomial.optionEquivRight` and then simplify further. I don't want to do this all at once because then it would be harder to understand as a human that each of these steps works and puts the hypothesis in a certain form. I therefore heavily use `simp only`, and I want to be able to reference this lemma directly, since everything else I am putting in the same `simp only` call.

Why not just include `map_const', prod_replicate, one_pow` in the simp only? I think it's because every other lemma in the simp only seems to have the form `List.sum_map_...` and I want to stay consistent, and not confuse the reader with this `replicate` function.

This all got switched from `Finset` to `List` when I ported it from 3 to 4. Summing over a function seems to make sense for `Finset` because a `Finset` can't have duplicates, and so there is this pattern of summing over a mapped list that arises when I did this switch. I think I wanted an analogous lemma to [Finset.sum_const_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Basic.html#Finset.sum_const_zero). Relatedly, we have things like [Multiset.prod_map_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Multiset/Basic.html#Multiset.prod_map_one). (Bit of a preexisting naming discrepancy there, if you like the `const` in the name that's fine with me I can change my PR or the `Multiset` lemma or both).

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8426452589/job/23074785841)

Thanks!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This should be true for a `MulOneClass`
Ok fair enough. The above assumptions all use `Monoid` so I have to generalize there too to fix this.
Yep, `prod_cons` does not necessarily hold for `MulOneClass` so I need a new `prod_one_cons` to cover this.
Can you move it to the `MulOneClass` section?
I think there is not much point here, keep it assuming `MulOneClass`
Ok I have switched it to `MulOneClass` (initially it was `Monoid`)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add lemma List.prod_map_one

nodes.body: I'm interested. What's your use case?

I have a project where I have lots of sums over `MvPolynomial` expressions. In the course of simplifying these expressions I sometimes come across this and want to simplify it.

I guess your next question will be "why not just use `simp`?. I think the main reason was probably for proof aesthetics - I conceptualize the simplification part of the proof as a sequence of steps where I first simplify various expressions involving sums over mapped lists, and then rearrange terms, and then I cast everything using `MvPolynomial.optionEquivRight` and then simplify further. I don't want to do this all at once because then it would be harder to understand as a human that each of these steps works and puts the hypothesis in a certain form. I therefore heavily use `simp only`, and I want to be able to reference this lemma directly, since everything else I am putting in the same `simp only` call.

Why not just include `map_const', prod_replicate, one_pow` in the simp only? I think it's because every other lemma in the simp only seems to have the form `List.sum_map_...` and I want to stay consistent, and not confuse the reader with this `replicate` function.

This all got switched from `Finset` to `List` when I ported it from 3 to 4. Summing over a function seems to make sense for `Finset` because a `Finset` can't have duplicates, and so there is this pattern of summing over a mapped list that arises when I did this switch. I think I wanted an analogous lemma to [Finset.sum_const_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Basic.html#Finset.sum_const_zero). Relatedly, we have things like [Multiset.prod_map_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Multiset/Basic.html#Multiset.prod_map_one). (Bit of a preexisting naming discrepancy there, if you like the `const` in the name that's fine with me I can change my PR or the `Multiset` lemma or both).

Thanks!
